importOntology

public java.lang.String importOntology()
                                throws java.lang.Exception
Description copied from interface: CommunicationService
Imports the ontology defined through the class annotations to the INT edition database. Replaces existing ontology information completely. Takes all registered classes into consideration (see OWLAnnotatedClassRegistry).

Specified by:
importOntology in interface CommunicationService
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

importInstanceData

public java.lang.String importInstanceData(java.util.List<java.lang.Object> objs)
                                    throws java.lang.Exception
Description copied from interface: CommunicationService
Imports the instance data defined through the object annotations to the INT edition database. Replaces existing instance data completely. Use this method only for testing purpose, as - combined with the normal sync mechanism - it will result in duplicate data.

Specified by:
importInstanceData in interface CommunicationService
Parameters:
objs - listing of objects from which to extract instance data
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

addOrUpdateDBObject

public void addOrUpdateDBObject(java.lang.Object newObj,
                                java.lang.String source,
                                java.lang.Long timestamp)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
Description copied from interface: CommunicationService
Brings the current object up-to-date in INT DB. If the object does not exist, it is created. Otherwise, we compute a diff using the old and new object, delete properties that are gone and add new properties into a context with the specified meta information.

Specified by:
addOrUpdateDBObject in interface CommunicationService
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

addOrUpdateDBObject

public void addOrUpdateDBObject(java.lang.Object newObj,
                                java.lang.String source,
                                java.lang.Long timestamp,
                                boolean recurse)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
Brings the current object up-to-date in INT DB. If the object does not exist, it is created. Otherwise, we compute a diff using the old and new object, delete properties that are gone and add new properties into a context with the specified meta information.

Specified by:
addOrUpdateDBObject in interface CommunicationService
Parameters:
obj -
subsource -
timestamp -
recurse - whether or not to recursively update @recursiveUpdate-annotated methods/properties
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
